topic.title: Git Center - an alternative to GitHub
topic.body:
﻿Git Center - GitHub for ZeroNet

Git Center is a decentralized hosting platform for Git repositories. We provide several collaboration features such as bug tracking for every project, and private and public repositories.


﻿Why Git Center?

Currently Git Center is the only repository hosting in ZeroNet. This is like 0git, but better: a full alternative to GitHub.

Cool! How can I access it?

Full link: [http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/)﻿
Currently you can also use [0sh.bit/?GitCenter](/0sh.bit/?GitCenter)

comment.body: In fact, there can be censorship of index, but I won't do that. But you would still be able to share blocked repositories by direct link and I won't be able to delete them.

And this is a difficult question.

First of all, after pushing, you should always press `Sign & Publish changes`. Then there should be no problems: all data will be synced, Git won't let you push if there are changes in remote repository.

Now a problem: pretend you are offline. You do some commits, push them, sign. Then you go online, ZeroNet updates site with a newer version, and your modifications are lost in remote repo. This is a problem, yeah, and there is an idea to implement merging of changes when you download newer version. But currenly you can `git fetch && git merge origin/master && git push`, then sign repository when you find your changes were removed.
